claim: Globally, advanced AI is poised to transform society primarily by (a) accelerating technological progress through automating research, (b) introducing artificial agents and AI‑integrated institutions as key decision‑makers, and (c) making durable centralization of power far easier—changes that could unfold quickly as capabilities scale.
explanation: Largely plausible but partly speculative. (a) There is strong evidence that AI already accelerates parts of scientific discovery and engineering (e.g., AlphaFold’s reshaping of structural biology; autonomous labs and AI‑guided materials discovery), though large‑scale validation and synthesis remain bottlenecks. ([ncbi.nlm.nih.gov](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC10011802/?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [osti.gov](https://www.osti.gov/pages/biblio/2281696-autonomous-laboratory-accelerated-synthesis-novel-materials?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) (b) AI is being embedded in consequential decision processes and agentic systems are operating in limited domains (e.g., robotaxis and other deployments), yet current evaluations show frontier “AI agents” still struggle with long‑horizon autonomy; real‑world public‑sector use has also produced high‑profile failures (e.g., the Dutch benefits scandal). Thus, AI‑integrated institutions as key decision‑makers are emerging but not yet widespread. ([hai.stanford.edu](https://hai.stanford.edu/ai-index/2025-ai-index-report), [aisi.gov.uk](https://www.aisi.gov.uk/work/advanced-ai-evaluations-may-update?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [docslib.org](https://docslib.org/doc/1315939/final-report-of-the-parliamentary-inquiry?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) (c) Credible analyses warn that heavy compute, data, and capital requirements are concentrating market power among a few firms, with rising training costs likely to entrench centralization—concerns echoed by competition authorities and economists. ([oecd.org](https://www.oecd.org/en/publications/2024/05/artificial-intelligence-data-and-competition_9d0ac766.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [arxiv.org](https://arxiv.org/abs/2405.21015?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [brookings.edu](https://www.brookings.edu/articles/market-concentration-implications-of-foundation-models-the-invisible-hand-of-chatgpt/?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) Finally, scaling trends and recent data show capabilities and deployment can change quickly as compute scales and costs fall, making rapid societal effects plausible. ([hai.stanford.edu](https://hai.stanford.edu/ai-index/2025-ai-index-report), [arxiv.org](https://arxiv.org/abs/2203.15556?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
